page.title: 05Employment
page.content: Clovelly people are{employed}on house maintenance, carparks, cafes, shops, hotels, schools, garages, P.O., agricultural contractors, farming, transport, fishing, boat trips, Lifeboat, accomodation and B&B trade, horticulture and forestry. Many work elsewhere, mainly in {Bideford}in building industry, shops, Torridge District Council, factories, transport, banks and offices. There is more employment in the summer than in the winter. Some people have more than 1 part time job. Some school - college leavers can only get{summer season}jobs locally and some go out of N. Devon to seek training and permanent work. Before mechanisation, many more people were employed in farming. In the 19th Century Clovelly was a thriving port.(1851 population 937).
